info.description:
# kerbal-klinker

Tested using Python 3.6.9

---

This project is a python module, which means that it is run in the following way:

`python3 -m klinker`

## Module documentation:

---

Help can be acquired by:

`python3 -m klinker --help`

---

## CURRENT LIMITATIONS:

---

It should be VERY well known that at the current stage in development these are the limitations of the code provided:

* Only one .ko object can be specified at this time. It isn't much of a linker but a "KerbalObject to KSM convetor"

* Only the Data and Main sections are currently supported, as I am planning to implement Function sections when I get to it with the assembler.

---

### Required arguments:

klinker requires one argument that corresponds to the path of the input .ko file.

For example, if there was a file called `launch.ko` it would be opened using:

`python3 -m klinker launch.ko`

This can be an absolute or relative path and should work on both linux and Windows, and possibly MacOS too.

---

### Optional arguments:

klinker has the option of specifying the output file name and path.

This can be specified using `-o` / `--output`

The default output location is in the current working directory, to a file named `out.ksm`

For example, if I wanted instead the output of my KerbalObject `launch.ko` file to be named `launch.ksm` it would be done using the following:

`python3 -m klinker launch.ko -o launch.ksm`

---

If you have any questions / suggestions let me know.

I do plan to clean up the code a little more, but I tried to write comments on every function and class to make it easier to look at. This was just enough to get a small linker in the KerbalObject format working.
info.name: kerbal-linker
info.summary: Python program for linking KerbalObject files into a runnable KSM file or shared library.
